title: Darnold shows grit after 2 INTs, rallies Seahawks
content: Sam Darnold overcame two crushing second-half interceptions and rallied the Seahawks from a 16-point deficit to stun the Rams and punch Seattle's ticket to the playoffs.

title: Puka dominates, rips refs again to cap chaotic day
content: After apologizing for a gesture that was "antisemitic in nature" earlier Thursday, Puka Nacua had one of the best games of his career and afterward criticized officials on social media.

title: Ex-NASCAR driver Biffle, family die in plane crash
content: Former NASCAR driver Greg Biffle and his family were among seven people killed in a plane crash Thursday in Statesville, North Carolina.

title: Jokic breaks record for career assists by center
content: Nikola Jokic passed Kareem Abdul-Jabbar as the NBA's career assists leader among centers in Thursday's win over the Magic.

title: McVay: Reversed 2-point call not one I've seen
content: Rams coach Sean McVay questioned a crucial 2-point conversion that allowed the Seahawks to tie Thursday night's score midway through the fourth quarter, saying after Los Angeles' 38-37 OT loss that he had "never quite seen anything like what happened."

title: Sources: King, Padres agree to 3-year, $75M deal
content: Right-hander Michael King and the San Diego Padres agreed to a three-year, $75 million contract, sources told ESPN's Jeff Passan on Thursday.

title: Ohio: Smith fired over affair with student, drinking
content: In an intent to terminate letter, Ohio University's president wrote that football coach Brian Smith's "extramarital affairs," including one with a student, brought "disrepute, scandal and ridicule," which violated his employment agreement.

title: Bickerstaff says ref Goble entered game with bias
content: Pistons coach J.B. Bickerstaff sounded off on official John Goble, saying his calls during Thursday night's game against the Mavs were "not objective."

content: LeBron James might be mortal. Zach Kram examines how the future Hall of Famer looks different compared to the past two decades.

content: USC's Jazzy Davidson tops our rankings also featuring Oklahoma's Aaliyah Chavez, UConn's Blanca QuiÃ±onez and more.

title: On the racetrack or in the air, Greg Biffle will be remembered as a hero
content: Greg Biffle died in a plane crash Thursday in North Carolina, where he'll be remembered not only as a NASCAR star, but as a humanitarian, too.

title: Geek and destroy: How Bruins winger Morgan Geekie has defied goal-scoring regression
content: Many expected the 27-year-old to take a step back from his 33 goals last season. Instead, he's on pace for 58.

title: WNBA CBA negotiations: What WNBPA's move to authorize strike means for labor talks
content: The Jan. 9 deadline is still weeks away, but the WNBPA has voted to authorize calling a strike "when necessary" during negotiations.

content: North Carolina's Caleb Wilson rounds out a solid top three while three new names crack the latest edition.

content: College walk-on athletes remain a fixture of Americana, but a recent settlement has put that storyline in doubt.

content: Who takes the top spot? Our college football experts rank the top 50 players from the College Football Playoff teams.

title: FIFA only harming itself with absurd World Cup ticket prices
content: FIFA's sky-high ticket prices for next summer's World Cup could come at the cost of the soul of the game: the fans who make it such a special event.

title: Will another injury derail Adams' World Cup prep for the U.S.?
content: Tyler Adams has been unlucky with injuries, and a recent MCL sprain will rob him of valuable prep time.

content: Only five of Wood Brothers Racing's 101 Cup Series wins have come after 1993, but the historic team is getting back to the front with Josh Berry.

title: NBA Futures: Thunder remain championship favorites; Knicks' title odds unchanged
content: The Oklahoma City Thunder are still big favorites to repeat as champions, while Shai Gilgeous-Alexander has moved back in front in the MVP race.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye Al Hilal star Neves
content: Manchester United have been put on alert as Al Hilal midfielder RÃºben Neves wants to return to the Premier League. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Westbrook continues revival, Huff, George are top-50 players
content: Eric Karabell forecasts what to expect from notable players such as Jaren Jackson Jr. and key New York Knicks.

title: Bangladesh unrest: Hindu man lynched, body tied to tree and set on fire
content: A Hindu man was beaten to death and his body set ablaze in Bangladesh's Mymensingh district following blasphemy allegations. This incident occurred amidst broader unrest, including attacks on media institutions and protests following the death of a student leader, raising concerns over minority safety and press freedom.

title: Luxury to lock-up: Luthra brothers sleep on floor, eat dal-rice
content: Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra, owners of Birch by Romeo Lane, spent their first night in a police lock-up after being arrested in connection with a fatal fire. They were interrogated extensively, and their request for mattresses was denied after medical examinations declared them fit. Other partners and managers have also been arrested and remanded in judicial custody.

title: Ex-gym trainer kicks toddler playing badminton on Bengaluru road
content: A incident unfolded in Thyagarajanagar, South Bengaluru, where a 35-year-old gym trainer allegedly kicked a five-year-old boy playing badminton. The unprovoked assault, captured on CCTV, left the child with injuries. Police have registered a case under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, with the accused reportedly undergoing psychiatric treatment.

title: Security guards smash Mercedes with sticks, batons in Gurgaon
content: Security guards in Gurgaon vandalized a Mercedes outside Cyber Park after the driver allegedly drove on the wrong side of the road. Witnesses reported an argument and alleged assault by the driver before guards retaliated, smashing the car's windshield, taillights, and side mirror. The incident, captured on video, has not yet resulted in a police complaint.

title: US immigration crackdown: Trump suspends green card lottery; what led to the step?
content: US President Donald Trump has suspended the diversity green card lottery program following deadly shootings at Brown University and MIT. Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem announced the pause, stating the suspect, Claudio Neves Valente, entered the US through this program. Valente, a Portuguese national, is suspected of multiple killings before dying by suicide.

title: 'Peter reported to me': Musk says he wasnâ€™t fired; calls PayPal exit 'palace coup'
content: Elon Musk refuted claims that Peter Thiel fired him as PayPal CEO in 2000, calling it a "palace coup" by the executive team and board. Musk stated he was the largest shareholder and CEO, with Thiel reporting to him. The leadership change occurred while Musk was on his honeymoon, with concerns over his strategic decisions cited as the reason.

title: What is SHANTI Bill 2025? Top things to know about the new nuclear energy bill
content: India's Lok Sabha has passed the SHANTI Bill, ushering in a significant overhaul of its civil nuclear framework. The legislation opens parts of the sector to private participation for the first time, aiming to boost nuclear power capacity and modernize regulations. It also introduces a new safety and liability framework.

title: Om Birla meets MPs as Parliament concludes: PM Modi, Priyanka in attendance
content: Parliament's Winter Session concluded Friday with Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha adjourned sine die. Despite disruptions over the VB-G RAM G Bill, both Houses saw significant legislative work, with Lok Sabha achieving 111% productivity. Key bills were passed, and leaders met to mark the session's end, though opposition protests continued.

title: Meta CEO Zuckerberg's 'highest-paid' employee is reportedly unhappy with his Boss
content: Meta's $14.8 billion investment in Scale AI and the integration of its CEO, Alexandr Wang, into a new "superintelligence" lab are reportedly facing internal friction. Wang allegedly finds Mark Zuckerberg's micromanagement "suffocating," while some staff question Wang's experience. This shift also clashes with Meta's open-source AI philosophy, leading to executive departures.

title: 'I was humiliated, slapped for not paying rent': Tenant strangles landlady in Delhi
content: Police arrested a tenant, Himanshu Yadav, for allegedly robbing and murdering his 65-year-old landlady in Rohini. Driven by anger over rent arrears and humiliation, Yadav strangled Naresh Kumari and stole her jewelry. He then fled across several states, mortgaging the stolen items before being apprehended in Delhi.

title: Gold price today: How much 22K and 24K gold costs in your city? Check rates
content: Gold prices opened lower on the MCX at Rs 1,34,027 per 10 grams, a 0.37% dip, but remain above the crucial Rs 1.34 lakh mark. Spot gold and US gold futures also saw declines, while silver prices retreated from a record high.

title: U19 Asia Cup semifinal: What if rain washes out India vs Sri Lanka clash?
content: India and Sri Lanka are set to clash in the ACC Under-19 Asia Cup semifinal, but persistent rain in Dubai poses a significant threat. If the match is washed out, India will advance to the final due to their superior group stage performance, having topped Group A with a perfect record.

title: 'Gemini 3 can do things that Copilot canâ€™t': Microsoft AI chief Suleyman
content: Microsoft's AI chief, Mustafa Suleyman, acknowledged Google's Gemini 3's capabilities while highlighting Copilot's unique strengths, particularly in real-time visual interaction. He emphasized Microsoft's commitment to developing AI that serves human interests, drawing a firm line against autonomous systems that could become uncontrollable. This stance follows a revised OpenAI agreement.

title: Adani group bets big on aviation! Plans to invest Rs 1 lakh cr in next 5 years
content: Adani Group plans a massive Rs 1 lakh crore investment in its airports business over five years, driven by strong growth projections for India's aviation sector. The company is set to launch commercial operations at Navi Mumbai International Airport, a significant expansion that will ease pressure on existing facilities and bolster the group's position as India's largest airport operator.

title: 'Dhurandhar' vs 'Avatar Fire And Ash': Ranveer Singh starrer slows down; crosses Rs 460cr
content: Dhurandhar has achieved a record-breaking second week at the box office, surpassing the collections of Pathaan and Gadar 2. The film, starring Ranveer Singh and others, earned â‚¹253 crore in its second week, bringing its total to â‚¹463.48 crore. Despite a slow start to its third week, Dhurandhar continues to compete as Avatar Fire And Ash gains momentum.

title: Indiaâ€™s exports to China jump 90% - but why there is little reason to cheer
content: India's exports to China saw a significant 90% surge in November, reaching $2.2 billion, primarily driven by naphtha and specific electronics. However, this spike masks underlying volatility and a growing import dependence on China. The trade deficit with China is widening, raising concerns about India's export strategy and reliance on Chinese goods.

title: UGC issues alert against 3 fake universities, warns students against invalid degrees
content: The University Grants Commission has issued a stern warning against three institutions â€“ NIMS, Delhi; Sarva Bharatiya Shiksha Peeth, Karnataka; and National Backward Krushi Vidyapeeth, Maharashtra â€“ operating as universities without legal recognition. These entities are issuing invalid degrees, which will not be accepted for further studies or employment. Students are urged to verify institutional recognition before admission.

title: Jeff Bezos & Lauren Sanchez finish Beverly Hills megaâ€‘mansion with UFO capsule
content: Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez are nearing completion of their lavish Beverly Hills mansion.  Acquired for $165 million, the estate boasts a unique UFO-shaped structure serving as a sauna.  The property also features a large swimming pool, sports courts, and a historic Georgian architectural style.  This mega-mansion reflects the couple's passion for adventure and technology.

title: Maple Leafs fans on edge as reporter hints Auston Matthews trade talks near
content: Maple Leafs captain Auston Matthews is facing scrutiny as his scoring has slowed. This has sparked discussions about his future with the team. Toronto management must navigate this delicate situation. The coming months will be crucial for both Matthews and the Maple Leafs' legacy. The team aims for immediate success.

title: Braun Strowman & Raquel Rodriguez net worth 2025: WWE earnings, lifestyle & more
content: Braun Strowman and Raquel Rodriguez showcase contrasting WWE financial journeys in 2025. Strowman, a former headliner, boasts an estimated net worth of $2-5 million, built on lucrative deals and merchandise. Rodriguez, a rising star, has a projected $700,000, with her value steadily increasing through television exposure and championship opportunities.

title: Brown University shooting: Was suspect a US citizen? Here's what we know
content: Brown University shooting suspect Claudio Manuel Neves-Valente, a Portuguese national, entered the US on a student visa and later obtained lawful permanent resident status. He is believed to have attended the same Portuguese university as MIT physics professor Nuno Loureiro, who was also found fatally shot. Security footage linked Valente to the professor's residence.

title: Why Davante Adams is not playing vs Seahawks today? Rams WR's return timeline revealed
content: Star wide receiver Davante Adams is out for the Rams' game against the Seahawks due to knee and hamstring injuries.  The 32-year-old, who leads the NFL with 14 receiving touchdowns, is being treated cautiously.  While his return is week-to-week, the team hopes for a playoff comeback, with an 11-day recovery window ahead.

title: Bangladesh on boil again: Why it matters for India - explained
content: Bangladesh slid back into turmoil after the killing of Sharif Osman Hadi, a prominent youth leader of last yearâ€™s July Uprising, triggered violent protests. The 32-year-old was shot by masked gunmen in central Dhaka while launching his election campaign and later died in hospital. His death has reignited political instability ahead of crucial national elections, with protests, arson and competing narratives deepening uncertainty at a critical moment for the country and its relations with New Delhi.

title: South Delhi businessman shot dead, 69 bullets found inside body
content: Dairy businessman Ratan was ambushed and shot dead in south Delhi, with shooters traveling from Faridabad and firing nearly 70 bullets. The brutal killing, possibly linked to a family feud and land dispute following his son's arrest for murder, involved 12-13 suspects who conducted reconnaissance before the attack.

title: 'Decisions feel knee-jerk': Anti-pollution move triggers Delhi border jams
content: Delhi's new pollution control measures, restricting vehicles below BS-VI standards, triggered significant traffic jams at state borders. Barricades at entry points led to long queues, forcing temporary removal to ease congestion. Commuters expressed frustration over disrupted routines and questioned the sole focus on vehicles.

title: 'Can't breathe': Journalists trapped inside as protesters storm and torch B'desh media houses
content: Widespread unrest erupted in Bangladesh following the death of youth leader Sharif Osman Hadi, a critic of former PM Sheikh Hasina. Protests turned violent in Dhaka, with attacks on major media houses and the Indian deputy ambassador's residence. Hadi was shot last month, just before elections he intended to contest.

title: Lady Gaga, Sinners & more: Obama shares 2025 favourites
content: Former US President Barack Obama has unveiled his annual list of favorite books, films, and music as 2025 concludes. The selections showcase his diverse tastes, notably featuring Indian and Indian-origin creators like vocalist Ganavya and authors Anita and Kiran Desai.  His film and music choices also span global artists and genres, continuing a White House tradition.

title: Red alert in North India: Dense fog in Delhi, UP, Punjab and Haryana; 150 flights cancelled
content: North India is grappling with a red alert for dense fog, severely impacting visibility and travel. Simultaneously, Delhi and surrounding regions are experiencing 'very poor' to 'severe' air quality, with authorities urging residents to limit outdoor exposure. Flights are facing delays due to the challenging weather conditions.

title: Gold price prediction: What's the gold outlook for today? What investors should know
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are experiencing selling pressure, with an intraday bias leaning downwards. Analysts recommend a sell-on-rise strategy, targeting resistance near â‚¹1,34,000. Technical indicators suggest weak momentum and potential for further downside extension, with key support levels identified at â‚¹1,33,000 and â‚¹1,32,500.

title: RRP Semiconductor Ltd: Why this stockâ€™s 55,000% rally is fuelling AI bubble fears
content: RRP Semiconductor Ltd. has experienced an astonishing 55,000% stock surge in 20 months, becoming a social media sensation and a cautionary tale for AI investors. Despite negative revenue and minimal operations, online hype and a small free float fueled its rise, now drawing regulatory scrutiny. The company has denied direct involvement in semiconductor manufacturing or celebrity endorsements.

title: Carrot juice with coconut milk: Better digestion, glowing skin and energy - benefits
content: Discover the comforting blend of carrot juice and coconut milk, a simple drink offering sustained wellness. This combination gently aids digestion, promotes a healthier complexion, and stabilizes energy levels by enhancing nutrient absorption. It's a nourishing choice that supports your body's natural rhythms without demanding drastic changes, proving that subtle support can yield lasting benefits.

title: IND vs SA: Bench strength on trial; Gill injury opens auditions as NZ series, T20 WC loom
content: Shubman Gill's injury opens doors for T20I experimentation, with Yashasvi Jaiswal and potentially Sanju Samson vying for the opener's spot. KL Rahul is being considered for a middle-order wicketkeeper role, while Rinku Singh and Ruturaj Gaikwad also remain in contention. The bowling unit is largely stable, though Axar Patel's absence might see Washington Sundar return.

title: Bengaluru horror: 2 college students, electrician arrested for gang-raping 19-year-old
content: Two college students and an electrician were arrested in Bengaluru for allegedly gang-raping a 19-year-old student and blackmailing her with an obscene video. The accused befriended the survivor on social media, secretly recorded private moments, and used the footage to coerce her into repeated sexual acts. Police have recovered their mobile phones for forensic analysis.

title: UAE on high alert as heavy rain, strong winds and travel disruptions continue
content: The UAE is experiencing unstable weather with heavy rain, thunderstorms, and strong winds due to a low-pressure system. Authorities have issued safety warnings, urging caution for motorists and advising against outdoor activities. Transport services, including intercity buses and flights from Dubai International, have been affected.

title: Inside Josh Allenâ€™s luxury car collection: A look at the Bills starâ€™s garage
content: Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen's impressive car collection showcases his journey from humble beginnings to NFL stardom. His garage features a mix of rugged trucks like the Ford F-150 Raptor and luxury SUVs such as the Jeep Grand Wagoneer and Range Rover Sport, reflecting his need for utility and comfort in Buffalo's climate.

title: Watch: Violence erupts after football match - 59 injured, trophy ceremony cancelled
content: Violent clashes marred Atletico Nacional's Copa Colombia final victory in Medellin, leaving at least 59 injured, including seven police officers. Fans from rival clubs stormed the pitch and clashed with security after the match. The trophy presentation was cancelled due to safety concerns, despite efforts to promote peaceful coexistence.

title: Bharti Singh & husband Haarsh welcomes their second child; blessed with a baby boy
content: Comedienne Bharti Singh has welcomed her second child, a baby boy, with husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa on December 19. She was expected to shoot for Laughter Chefs season 3 when she went into labour at home. Both mother and newborn are healthy, adding to their family which already includes their three-year-old son, Gola.

title: 'Lolita', Bill Gates and passports: New Epstein photos released
content: New photos from Jeffrey Epstein's estate have emerged, implicating prominent figures like Bill Gates and Sergey Brin. The House Oversight Committee released these images, raising questions about the Department of Justice's handling of the case.  The documents, including cryptic messages and personal items, are being unveiled ahead of a crucial deadline, fueling calls for full transparency.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 trades above 25,900; BSE Sensex jumps 500 points
content: Indian equity indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, opened higher on Friday, mirroring positive global cues driven by cooling US inflation. While FIIs have paused selling, market direction hinges on the Bank of Japan's commentary regarding future rate hikes. Asian stocks also rose, buoyed by expectations of US Federal Reserve rate cuts.

title: Donald Trump hypes UFC White House fight with candid shout-out to Dana White
content: Donald Trump has announced plans to host a historic UFC fight on the White House South Lawn as part of Americaâ€™s 250th anniversary celebrations in 2026. Scheduled for Flag Day on June 14, the event will be hosted by UFC CEO Dana White and feature top champion fighters. The fight is part of Trumpâ€™s broader Freedom 250 agenda.

title: Rupee continues to rebound! Currency rises to 89 against US dollar
content: The Indian rupee experienced an upward trend against the US dollar on Friday, following a period of significant depreciation. This recovery is largely attributed to the Reserve Bank of India's strategic dollar sales, aimed at curbing one-way currency weakness.

title: Four Decembers of Ishan Kishan: Double century, dropped, Bhagavad Gita and redemption
content: Ishan Kishanâ€™s career has swung between extremes â€” a historic double century, prolonged benching, questions over attitude and eventual spiritual rediscovery. Across four Decembers in four years, the wicketkeeper-batter found solace in the Bhagavad Gita amid professional setbacks. Now leading Jharkhand with explosive returns, Kishanâ€™s hunger to reclaim his India place burns brighter than ever.

title: ICICI Prudential AMC listing: Stock lists at 20% premium; check price, outlook & more
content: ICICI Prudential AMC debuted on the stock market with a premium, trading on both BSE and NSE. The IPO saw strong investor demand, particularly from Qualified Institutional Buyers. Brokerages maintain a positive long-term outlook, citing the company's strong financial performance, diversified assets, and India's growing financialization trend. Experts suggest it's a good long-term investment opportunity.

title: Bangladesh Protests LIVE Updates: Dhaka Condemns Lynching Of Hindu Man In Protests
content: Bangladesh Violence LIVE Updates: Bangladesh has been rocked by violent protests since late Thursday after the death of student leader Sharif Osman Hadi, with concerns of further unrest ahead of national elections in the country.

title: Trump's Return, Gaza Ceasefire, Louvre Heist: 10 Events That Defined 2025
content: Donald Trump's return to power, a ceasefire in Gaza and massive investments in artificial intelligence: Here are 10 events that defined 2025.

title: Indigenous Group's Protest Outside Bangladesh Mission And A '1971' Reminder
content: Hundreds of indigenous youth and students on Friday staged a protest in front of the Deputy High Commission of Bangladesh in Agartala, condemning recent alleged threats and derogatory remarks made by Hasnat Abdullah, a Bangladeshi leader.

title: Hindu Man Lynched, Set On Fire In Bangladesh Amid Anti-India Protests
content: Amid anti-India protests in Bangladesh, a young Hindu man was killed in a mob lynching in Bhaluka Upazila of Mymensingh district over allegations of insulting Islam. Angry protestors then set the body of Dipu Chandra Das, 30, on fire.

title: YouTuber's Dubai Wedding Under Scrutiny Amid Money Laundering 'Links'
content: The heat on YouTuber Anurag Dwivedi has intensified, as the Enforcement Directorate has turned its eye on his lavish Dubai wedding amid his alleged money laundering links.

title: 29 Workers At J&K Power Plant Have Terror Links, NDTV Accesses Letter
content: The power plant workers have been found involved in "subversive and anti-national activities," as per the police investigation.

title: Amid PM Modi's Assam Visit, Congress To Launch Manifesto Consultations
content: Even as all eyes remain on PM Narendra Modi's two-day visit to Assam on December 20 and 21, the main opposition Congress has announced a parallel statewide outreach, kicking off manifesto consultations and a mass outreach yatra on Decembe

title: Willful Intoxication, Delayed Medical Help: Revelations In Zubeen Death Case
content: The chargesheet filed in the investigation into the death of singer Zubeen Garg has listed some extremely sensitive accusations against the seven accused, who have been charged with murder.

title: In Mahua Moitra Cash For Query Case, Delhi High Court Sets Aside Lokpal Order
content: The Delhi High Court on Friday set aside an order of the Lokpal granting sanction to the CBI to file a chargesheet against Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra in the alleged cash-for-query scam.

title: "Why Sabotage Andhra's Future": Nara Lokesh Targets Jagan Reddy's Party On Pleas Against IT Projects
content: TDP national general secretary and Andhra Pradesh Minister for IT, Electronics and Communications Nara Lokesh criticised the filing of multiple Public Interest Litigations (PILs) against major IT park projects in the state

title: Adani Group To Invest Rs 1 Lakh Crore On Airports In Next 5 Years
content: Adani Group plans to invest Rs 1 lakh crore in its airports business over the next five years, betting on sustained growth in India's aviation sector, which is expected to expand at 15-16 per cent annually, a top group official said.

title: Rajasthan Man's Nose Chopped Off As Families Clash Over Love Marriage
content: At least two people were seriously injured in Rajasthan's Barmer on Wednesday night after a dispute between two families over alove-marriageboiled over.

title: Agencies Launch Probe Into Bondi Shooter's India-Australia Trips, Visa Status
content: Central and state agencies in India have launched a detailed investigation into the Bondi Beach attacker Sajid Akram's immigration history, visa status, and travel movements between India and Australia.

title: Drunk Scorpio Driver Goes On Rampage In Faridabad, Hits Several Vehicles
content: Panic gripped Faridabad late at night after a black Scorpio went on a reckless rampage along Mathura Road Highway (NH-19), ramming into multiple vehicles while speeding from Ballabhgarh to Old Faridabad.

title: Woman Lawyer Alleges Sexual Assault Inside Noida Police Station, Supreme Court Seeks CCTV Footage
content: The Supreme Court has sought the CCTV footage from the Sector 126 Noida police station in a sealed cover of an alleged incident where a woman lawyer was illegally detained for 14 hours and subjected to sexual assault and custodial torture.

title: How Waltons Reportedly Became The Richest Family In The World Through Walmart
content: In a small town in the US state of Arkansas, a young Sam Walton had a vision. It was to sell everyday goods at low prices, even in towns others overlooked.

title: Live Updates: NDTV Indian Of The Year Awards 2025
content: NDTV will recognise and celebrate outstanding Indians across 14 diverse categories spanning business leadership, innovation, philanthropy, governance, sports, entertainment, culture, and science.

title: UK Sanctions Pakistani Tycoon Murtaza Lakhani For Russia Energy Role
content: The UK sanctioned oil trading tycoon Murtaza Lakhani, part of a new package targeting Russia over its war against Ukraine.

title: Video: Guards Smash Mercedes' Windscreen, Windows With Sticks In Gurugram
content: Driving on the wrong side of the road in Gurugram turned disastrous for a Mercedes owner after security guards attacked his car with sticks and batons, smashing all the windows.

content: The winter chill intensified at many places in Punjab and Haryana as a thick blanket of fog enveloped several areas in both States

content: Uttam Saha, while speaking to a journalist, had accused Ganguly of being the actual man behind organising Messi's G.O.A.T India tour

content: The company claimed the issue was settled earlier by the Customs tribunal, which held that Customs duty could not be levied again on re-imports following repairs

content: The panel discussion was moderated by Dr. Rakesh Kalapala, director of the Centre for Obesity and Metabolic Therapy at AIG Hospitals

content: The anomaly came to the fore during a vigilance drive by the health department, said a release by the district information officer

title: India marks first-ever milestone by clearing more child sexual abuse cases than filed

title: Woman shooter raped at Faridabad hotel, 3 arrested

The policy seeks to cut bureaucratic red tape, extend public transport and strengthen safety and sanitation, projecting a â‚¹26,000-crore economic boost and creation of lakhs of jobs by 2032.Â Serish NanisettiÂ reports on how this initiative offers an early glimpse of Telanganaâ€™s ambitious $3 trillion economy envisioned under Vision 2047

title: Pari nagaswaram and musical tradition of Thyagarajaswamy Temple in Tiruvarur
content: The Pari nagaswaram is traditionally played only at the Tiruvarur temple, by a single family, which has held the right for generations. The instrument is tuned to madhyama kala sruti, requiring extraordinary lung power to play â€” almost 3 times as that needed to play a regular nagaswaram. It also produces an exceptionally powerful sound

title: Sekkipatti: where Muslims receive temple honours and Hindus worship, make offerings at aÂ dargah
content: Sekkipatti, a village in Melur taluk in Madurai, is a primarily agrarian village that serves as one of the best examples of religious harmony between Hindus and Muslims that can be seen in southern Tamil Nadu. In the village, there is no discrimination between the two communities, and a traditional familial kinship has existed throughout the years

title: Seahawks mount 16-point comeback, defeat Rams in OT to take over NFC West
content: the Seattle Seahawks beat the los Angeles Rams 38-37 in overtime to clinch a spot in the playoffs . the team looked like one of the best teams in the NFL while compiling an 11-3 record . it was all but written about how the seahawks would have to take the long road . they erased a 16-point deficit in the fourth quarter after the game was turning into a blowout foll .
